required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: External Beam Radiation Therapy and Cetuximab Followed by Irinotecan and Cetuximab for Children and Young Adults With Newly Diagnosed Diffuse Pontine Tumors and High-Grade Astrocytomas
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Trial of External Beam Radiation Therapy and Cetuximab Followed by Irinotecan and Cetuximab for Children and Young Adults With Newly Diagnosed Diffuse Pontine Tumors and High-Grade Astrocytomas (POE08-01)

brief_summary.textblock:
Standard treatment for patients with diffuse pontine tumors is radiation therapy, but less than 10% of patients are cured. Adding standard chemotherapy has not improved the cure rate.
Standard treatment for high-grade astrocytomas is surgery and radiation. The surgeon removes as much of the tumor as she or he can. Radiation after that tries to kill any cancer cells that are left. Some patients also get chemotherapy. These are anti-cancer drugs. They can be given during or after radiation. Current standard treatments do not cure many patients.
In this study the doctors are adding a new medication called cetuximab to the treatment and will also use a chemotherapy medication (irinotecan) that has been promising for patients treated for recurrent disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With High-grade Astrocytoma and Diffuse Pontine Tumors Achieving One Year Progression Free Survival.

primary_outcome.description: To determine the safety of cetuximab administered weekly in conjunction with involved field external beam radiation therapy for diffuse pontine tumors and high-grade astrocytomas, toxicities will be assessed via the NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, version 3.0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Have Undergone Tumor Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Participant tumor analysis for potential associations between primary tumor tissue molecular markers and tumor response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Samples Demonstrating EGFR Copy Number Gain
secondary_outcome.description: Identify gene transcripts for putative cetuximab

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participant Tumors Analyzed for Potential Association Between Histology (Grade) With Protein and ELISA Measurements of Those Proteins.
Percentage of Participants With Development of Rash, Either Acneiform and/or Desquamation
secondary_outcome.description: The purpose is to investigate whether the rash associated with cetuximab is secondary to an inflammatory pathway initiated and mediated by the action of cetuximab on host cells.

arm_group.description: This is a 2-group parallel (high-grade astrocytoma, diffuse pontine tumor), single stage study investigating cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan in pediatric and young adult patients. Optional exploratory components of the study include (1) correlation of tumor molecular markers with outcome, (2) CSF proteomics, and (3) assay of serum cytokine levels in patients who develop a cetuximab-associated rash.

This is a 2-group parallel (high-grade astrocytoma, diffuse pontine tumor), single stage study investigating cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan in pediatric and young adult patients. Optional exploratory components of the study include (1) correlation of tumor molecular markers with outcome, (2) CSF proteomics, and (3) assay of serum cytokine levels in patients who develop a cetuximab-associated rash.

intervention.intervention_name: cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan
intervention.description: External beam radiation therapy (5940 cGy in 180 cGy fractions) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose).4-8 weeks rest, 10 cycles of irinotecan (16 mg/m2/day x 5 consecutive days x 2 weeks) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose) at about 21 day intervals. Research biological evaluations will be performed in consenting patients as an optional portion of the study. Cetuximab is to be given every 7 days (+/- 2 days). Cetuximab does not need to be given on Day 1 of each week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have either (1) histologic proof of a high-grade astrocytoma reviewed by a POETIC institutional pathologist or (2) a radiological diagnosis via MRI scan of a typical diffuse pontine tumor made by a POETIC institutional neuroradiologist. Patients with a radiological diagnosis via MRI scan of a typical diffuse pontine tumor will be enrolled on the diffuse pontine tumor arm of the study regardless of histology in cases that are biopsied. Note: For collaborating non-POETIC institutions, the reviews may be done by an institutional pathologist/neuroradiologist.
- Patients must begin study prescribed therapy within 42 days of neurosurgical resection or biopsy of the tumor (high-grade astrocytoma patients) or radiological diagnosis (diffuse pontine tumor patients).
- Age ≥ 3-years and < 22-years-old.
- Brain MRI (and any other studies done according to clinical indications) must not show any definitive evidence of leptomeningeal or extra-neural metastases.
- ANC ≥ 1000/μL and platelet count ≥ 100,000/μL
- Patients must have adequate organ function as defined by:
- Hepatic: total bilirubin < 1.5 mg/dl, AST ≤ 2.5 x the upper limit of normal.
- Renal: serum creatinine ≤ 1.5 x the upper limit of normal for age, or calculated creatinine clearance or nuclear GFR ≥ 70 ml/min/1.73 m2.
- The patient, or for minors, a parent or legal guardian, must give informed written consent indicating they are aware of the investigational nature of this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of leptomeningeal or extra-neural metastatic disease.
- Prior radiation therapy or chemotherapy
- Pregnancy, mothers unwilling to refrain from breast-feeding, and sexually mature patients unwilling to practice an effective form of birth control.
- Other significant concomitant medical illnesses that would compromise the patient's ability to receive all prescribed study therapy.
- Prior therapy which specifically and directly targets the EGFR pathway.
- Prior severe infusion reaction to a monoclonal antibody.
- Significant history of uncontrolled cardiac disease; i.e., uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina, recent myocardial infarction (within prior 6 months), uncontrolled congestive heart failure, and cardiomyopathy with decreased ejection fraction.
- Patients with known Gilbert's Syndrome.

facility.name: University of Colorado Health Sciences Center
MD Anderson Cancer Center Orlando at Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children
Children's Healthcare of Atlanta at Egleston

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Pts With High-grade Astrocytoma
group.description: This is a 2-group parallel (high-grade astrocytoma, diffuse pontine tumor), single stage study investigating cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan in pediatric and young adult patients. Optional exploratory components of the study include (1) correlation of tumor molecular markers with outcome, (2) CSF proteomics, and (3) assay of serum cytokine levels in patients who develop a cetuximab-associated rash. cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan: External beam radiation therapy (5940 cGy in 180 cGy fractions) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose).4-8 weeks rest, 10 cycles of irinotecan (16 mg/m2/day x 5 consecutive days x 2 weeks) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose) at about 21 day intervals. Research biological evaluations will be performed in consenting patients as an optional portion of the study. Cetuximab is to be given every 7 days (+/- 2 days). Cetuximab does not need to be given on Day 1 of each week.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Have Undergone Tumor Analysis
measure.description: Participant tumor analysis for potential associations between primary tumor tissue molecular markers and tumor response.

outcome.title: Number of Samples Demonstrating EGFR Copy Number Gain
outcome.description: Identify gene transcripts for putative cetuximab
outcome.population: Paraffin-embedded tumor sections were obtained from 19 of 23 patients who underwent surgery (18 HGA and one DIPG). Because only 1 DIPG sample was available and based on the number of available samples per arm it was pre-specified to pool data for this Outcome Measure.

group.title: HGA and DIPG Tumors Analyzed
group.description: Paraffin-embedded tumor sections were obtained from 19 of 23 patients who underwent surgery (18 HGA and one DIPG tumors). Found tumor markers are reported as one group in the publication.

measure.title: Number of Samples Demonstrating EGFR Copy Number Gain
measure.description: Identify gene transcripts for putative cetuximab
measure.population: Paraffin-embedded tumor sections were obtained from 19 of 23 patients who underwent surgery (18 HGA and one DIPG). Because only 1 DIPG sample was available and based on the number of available samples per arm it was pre-specified to pool data for this Outcome Measure.

group.title: Pts With Diffuse Pontine Tumor
group.description: This is a 2-group parallel (high-grade astrocytoma, diffuse pontine tumor), single stage study investigating cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan in pediatric and young adult patients. Optional exploratory components of the study include (1) correlation of tumor molecular markers with outcome, (2) CSF proteomics, and (3) assay of serum cytokine levels in patients who develop a cetuximab-associated rash. cetuximab in conjunction with external beam radiation therapy, followed by cetuximab and irinotecan: External beam radiation therapy (5940 cGy in 180 cGy fractions) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose).4-8 weeks rest, 10 cycles of irinotecan (16 mg/m2/day x 5 consecutive days x 2 weeks) with weekly cetuximab (250 mg/m2/dose) at about 21 day intervals. Research biological evaluations will be performed in consenting patients as an optional portion of the study. Cetuximab is to be given every 7 days (+/- 2 days). Cetuximab does not need to be given on Day 1 of each week.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
